text: Hello! Not sure if this is the right spot to ask, but I'm working on the HubSpot Developer Practicum right now and I can't seem to figure out how to get the draggable handles in the DND section. I am able to get the DND area to show, but when I place two modules inside of it, it does not give me the option to adjust the width of each module. Would someone be able to help me out?
Make sure youre using {% dnd_module %} as the module tags. and not the standard module tag. <@U02J3EFR2MB>
Can you send us some code snippets to see what youre working with? That will also help a lot!
This is what I had. I actually figured it out, I had to add the _layout.css file from the boilerplate theme... Not too sure if that goes against the Practicum assignment....
Oh no - the layout.css file should def be included. That is the scaffolding for the whole framework
That's what I thought, I was just thrown off because it says in the directions to "Create a Theme from Scratch". Thank you so much for your help!
Ahhh for sure - Yea you need those files. I think the “from scratch” part is just using your own styles, theme settings, modules, etc.

HI, I am finishing a site for a client. They want some specific mobile formatting, with some elements to be centered on mobile and left aligned on desktop.  Is there a simple way to do this? I keep getting this unhelpful message:  "You are in responsive editing mode
You can only edit modules from desktop editing mode. To change views, click the desktop icon at the top."
